  • Description: A plastic jerrycan was dropped during the loading process. The jerrycan received a puncture on the bottom causing a release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024110290
item.description:
Report E-2024110290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS STEEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 6, 2024, a spill incident occurred at the Heidtman Butler facility involving an overfill of a tanker truck. During a product transfer operation, the driver failed to actively monitor the flow from the dome of the tanker truck, which is required to prevent overflow. Instead, the driver was standing at the back of the trailer, timing the transfer rather than visually overseeing the product flow from the dome. As a result, approximately 300 gallons of ferrous chloride solution (372 pounds) overflowed from the tanker, spilling onto the facilityâ€™s limestone gravel bed.

item.title: Report X-2024110412
item.description:
Report X-2024110412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with a UN spec marking and warning sticker was presented to the spill agent at the HNBA location. The spill agent checked the packing spill that contained a SDS stating the contents were UN3175 class 4. There were no DG markings or paperwork attached for transportation. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024110209
item.description:
Report E-2024110209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: Greenwood
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of product released from one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Personnel advised that release was due to a packaging failure. Dayton Freight personnel confirmed they cleaned release using Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
